api.name: dossiers
api.description: Manages dossiers. Specifying a dossier-name returns a single dossier.

methods.description: Fetches either the entire list of dossiers available in the catalog or a since dossier if either a dossier's name, its id or the suffix of a dossier's name is specified. The results are limited by the availabilty of the dossier provided its definition includes fencing restrictions.

sections.title: Fields
rows: The index corresponding to the default page to be displayed if no page is specified when displaying the dossier.
The pages available in the dossier.
The source of the page's data.
The connection details of the page's data source.
The formatting definition of the dossier.
The style associated with the title of the dossier.
The style associated with the column header section of the page when displaying a grid.
The time when the dossier was created by the author.
The time when the dossier last modified.
The information related to the dossier availability as a service.
Whether the dossier is ready for client consumption. <_{"shared":1}_> indicates dossier has been published.
The time when the dossier got published by the author.
The information about viewing the dossier viewing restrictions.

The list of IP addresses that can view the dossier. If no list is provided no restrictions apply. Each value on the list can take * and ? as wildcards, for instance <<"10.12.34.*">> or <<"10.12.34.21?">>
The list of time ranges that indicates when the dossier can be viewed, for instance: <<["9:00-12:00", "16:00-18:00"]>>

A list of objects representing dates and times within those dates that indicates when the dossier can be viewed. <_time_> is optional. If no <_end_> is specified, the date window has no end. If no <_start_> is specified, the date window has no beginning.
The start date of the viewing window.
The end date of the viewing window.
The list of time ranges withing the date window that indicates when the dossier can be viewed, for instance: <<["9:00-12:00", "16:00-18:00"]>>

methods.description: Updating a dossier will automatically update the <_time_modified_> field to the current time. Publishing a dossier, by updating a dossier using <_{"service.shared": 1}_> will also update the <_service.time_published_> field to the current time.

sections.title: Parameters
rows: A flat JSON representation of the fields to changed, using (.) notation, for example: <<{ "name": "New Dossier Name" }>> or <<{ "name": "New Dossier Name", "service.shared": 1 }>>

methods.description: Deletes the specified dossier from the dossier catalog.
Adds a new dossier to the catalog. The name given to a dossier must be unique.

api.name: -- /time_modified
api.description: The last modification time of a dossier.

methods.description: Returns a json response which includes the last modification time of a dossier either by dossier name, id or the suffix of a dossier's name. The results are limited by the availabilty of the dossier provided its definition includes fencing restrictions.

sections.title: Fields
rows: The time when the dossier last modified.
